messageBody:
> Now the test is successful, however, I have very skeptical about it. I
> don't know if it's ok to pass the
> testDatabase to the test case like this

It's one solution. It has the drawback that you can't use the
reflection mechanism to create your TestSuite. If you want to do so,
you'll have to do something like this (in the suite() method of your
Helper):

suite = new TestSuite(DataLockTestHelper.class);
return new TestSetup(suite) {
Database database;
public void setUp() {
// start the database
for (int ii = 0; ii < fTests.testCount(); ii++) {
MyTestCase test = (FilerTestCase) fTests.testAt(ii);
test.setDatabase(database);
}
}
public void tearDown() {
// stop the database
}
};

Another solution is to use a static variable to hold your database. You
can use the ResourceManager of the JUnit-addons package for this purpose.
